page.title: 09Guy Fawkes and Catesby
page.content: One of the most important aspects of Ashby's local history was its involvement in the gunpowder plot of 1605. Guy Fawks and Robert Catesby led a group of 8 plotters hoping to blow up arliament, kill King James, and restore England to the Catholic religion. Their plan was foiled by guards who searched the cellars of parliament. It is believed that the plotters made their plans in Robert Catesby's manor house which still stands near the church in Ashby.The plotters room is in the gatehouse over the main entrance to the manor house. The manor house is still in private lands and it is not open to the public.
